quizzes.title: History Quiz: Antietam and Battle
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, bushido, casualties. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Japanese samurai warriors were mostly illiterate in the past.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: When was the Battle of Antietam fought?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: September, 1862

questions.question: Bushido is the philosophy and code of conduct of the Japanese samurai. What does the word Bushido literally mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Way of the warrior

questions.question: Who was the Confederate commander at the Battle of Antietam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert E. Lee

questions.question: Who was the Union commander at the Battle of Antietam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George McClellan

questions.question: Which battle preceded the Battle of Antietam?

options.text: The Second Battle of Bull Run

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Second Battle of Bull Run

questions.question: How many soldiers - Union and Confederate - were casualties at Antietam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 23,000

questions.question: Which Union general, wounded in the foot at Antietam, would, within six months time, be the commander of the Army of the Potomac?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Hooker

questions.question: How long did the Battle of Antietam last?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1 day

questions.question: Which of these landmarks would NOT be found on the Antietam battlefield?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sherfys Peach Orchard

questions.question: What is the term for the person who was usually the master of the Japanese samurai?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daimyo

questions.question: What English sailor is believed to be the first Caucasian to receive the honor of becoming a samurai?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: William Adams

questions.question: In what century is James Clavells samurai novel Shogun set?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seventeenth century

questions.question: Who would arrange the marriage of the Japanese samurai by tradition?

options.text: Someone with the same or higher rank

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Someone with the same or higher rank

questions.question: Who served as President of the Confederate States of America at the time of the Battle of Antietam?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jefferson Davis

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Century and Mesozoic
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, mean, caesar. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Oxygen levels during the Mesozoic were lower than todays levels.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what century did the Black Death kill about one third of the European population?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14th century AD

questions.question: The base of the Mesozoic is established by what major event in the history of life on Earth?

options.text: A mass extinction 251 million years ago

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A mass extinction 251 million years ago

questions.question: In this century, the decline of the Classical Maya civilization began, and Charlemagne was crowned the first Holy Roman Emperor by Pope Leo III.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 8th century AD

questions.question: What marine reptiles evolved during the Triassic period and thrived during much of the Mesozoic era?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ichthyosaurs

questions.question: What does the term Mesozoic mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Middle life

questions.question: During what century is the King Arthur believed to have lived?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6th century AD

questions.question: What super-continent began to rift apart during the Mesozoic era?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pangaea

questions.question: What century marked the fall of the Western Roman Empire?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5th century AD

questions.question: During this century, the condom, the land mine and the sandpaper were invented.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 13th century AD

questions.question: In what century were the fountain pen, shaving soap and street lamps invented?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 9th century AD

questions.question: The Byzantine period began in this century which also saw the  Valerians massacre of Christians.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3rd century AD

questions.question: Julius Caesar, Marcus Antonius, and Cleopatra VII of Egypt all lived in this century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1st century BC

questions.question: The first novel ever is believed to have been written in this century by the Japanese Lady Murasaki Shikibu.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 11th century AD

questions.question: Nostradamus, Martin Luther and Elizabeth I of England lived during what century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 16th century AD

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Dinosaurs and Dinosaur
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, reptile, plesiosaurs. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: An incomplete skeleton of this dinosaur was discovered in 1900.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tyrannosaurus

questions.question: Which of the following describes the climate of the Triassic period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Arid

questions.question: Did all dinosaurs become extinct at the end of the Cretaceous period 65 million years ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Ichthyosaurs, plesiosaurs, pliosaurs, moasaurs, are pterosaurs are dinosaurs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What event signalled the end of the Mesozoic era?

options.text: A large mass extinction at the end of the Cretaceous

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A large mass extinction at the end of the Cretaceous

questions.question: What does the term Cenozoic mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Recent life

questions.question: Which of the following was a large inland sea that covered much of central North America during the Late Cretaceous period?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Western Interior Seaway

questions.question: What genus of dinosaur contains what could be the largest dinosaur ever?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amphicoelias

questions.question: Did dinosaurs become extinct due to a large asteroid impact?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Dinosaurs first evolved during the middle Triassic period approximately how many years ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 225 million years ago

questions.question: Several hundred specimens of this species of dinosaur were discovered at Ghost Ranch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coelophysis bauri

questions.question: Tyrannosaurus is more closely related to smaller predatory dinosaurs such as Velociraptor than to the more massive carnosaurs such as Allosaurus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Dinosaurs once existed on every continent except Antarctica.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Name the early reptile creatures that evolved during the late Permian period and eventually gave rise to the dinosaurs and other creatures during the Mesozoic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thecodontians

questions.question: How many epochs is the Cenozoic era divided into?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Cenozoic and Years
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, mean, subcontinent. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the term Precambrian mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Before-Cambrian

questions.question: The first true Homo sapiens (human) appeared in Africa about how many years ago?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 250,000 years ago

questions.question: Where do the oldest rocks on Earth come from?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nuvvuagittuq greenstone belt

questions.question: The Messinian salinity crisis occurred when the Mediterranean sea evaporated completely during the Pliocene epoch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: All recorded historical events occurred during this epoch.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Holocene

questions.question: Animals did not evolve during the Precambrian.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: About 2.7 billion years ago Stromatolites were widespread in the Precambrian seas and still exist in hypersaline areas such as Shark Bay, Australia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Multicellular organisms evolved during what period of the Mesoproterozoic era?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ectasian

questions.question: Approximately what age are the oldest known fossils?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 3.8 billion years old

questions.question: Horses evolved in North America during the Cenozoic era but became extinct there 10,000 years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When did the earth form?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4.5 billion years ago

questions.question: The appearance of free oxygen in the atmosphere caused a mass extinction of anaerobic organisms.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This subcontinent collided with Eurasia 55 million years ago.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indian subcontinent

questions.question: What event signalled the end of the Cenozoic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cenozoic has not ended.

questions.question: Grass did not evolve during the Cenozoic era.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: U.s. and Year
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, college, ford. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: On what album released in 1986 would I find the following lyrics:

options.text: d what my father said and let my mother mold me

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Control - Janet Jackson

questions.question: When did Boston become a settlement and who led it?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1630 - John Winthrop

questions.question: Which one happened to the U.S. in 1774?

options.text: Noah Webster publishes his American dictionary
The Bill of Rights goes into effect

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island abolished slavery

questions.question: This style dominated both music and fashion in the late 70s and early 80s. The Sex Pistols and The Exploited were just some of bands that had great influence on mens and womens look.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Punk

questions.question: Which one happened to the U.S. in 1796?

options.text: Nat Turner led slave rebellion in Virginia
Lewis and Clark begin westward survey
George Washington gives his farewell address

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Washington gives his farewell address

questions.question: When was the first U.S. adhesive postage stamp sold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1847

questions.question: Harvard College was founded in what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1636

questions.question: What did Benjamin Franklin do in 1752?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Proved lightning is electricity

questions.question: Was there a Black Hawk War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The lefty, Henry Ford, founded the Ford Motor Company. Finish this quote and find out how he defined quality.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ...no one is looking.

questions.question: This fashionable head accessory was hip from the very beginning of the 80s until their end.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Headband

questions.question: Which one happened to the U.S. in 1791?

options.text: Bill of Rights goes into effect
1st recorded UFO sighting by an American
Benedict Arnold found guilty of being a traitor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill of Rights goes into effect

questions.question: What event signalled the end of the Precambrian?

options.text: The evolution of organisms with hard shells
A large mass extinction that occurred 542 million years ago

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The evolution of organisms with hard shells

questions.question: The Erie Canal is a canal in New York State, United States, that runs from the Hudson River to Lake Erie, connecting the Great Lakes with the Atlantic Ocean.  The entire canal was opened in which year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1825

questions.question: When did Francis Drake enter San Francisco bay and what country did he claim it for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1579 - Britain

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Style and 80s
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, jackson, point. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: These trinkets were often sold in a pack of 10-15. They were made of lightweight metal and came in gold, silver or color hues.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bangle bracelets

questions.question: Which nickname did Thomas Jonathan Jackson earn after managing to hold off the Union forces back at Henry House Hill?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stonewall

questions.question: As a popular style in the beginning of the 80s it became somewhat politically bound, these started appearing as common clothing adornments.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Political and social slogans

questions.question: He was in command at the critical point in the Battle of Gettysburg?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joshua Chamberlain

questions.question: Dixie was composed in 1859 by this man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Decatur Emmett

questions.question: The style that became popular after the mid 80s includes ragged T-shirts, acid washed and torn jeans, cheap shirts, rubber bracelets, lots of hairspray and neon earrings.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grunge

questions.question: The Civil War produced a number of technical innovations. One of the following was not used in this war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tanks

questions.question: In 1987 Nike introduced these trainers that enable the wearer to jump higher.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Air

questions.question: This type of pants became the craze in the mid 80s. They had zippered patch pockets and zippered ankles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parachute pants

questions.question: Did the opposing armies often fraternize and call each other Johnny Reb and Billy Yank?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In order to be trendy in the 80s you should do this with your hair.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bleach it

questions.question: General Grant said that the final charge at Cold Harbor was the only action he regretted taking during the war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This famous perfume was released in 1985. Its fragrance is made up of coriander, plum, anise, rosewood, rose, tuberose, honey, cinnamon, orange blossom, blackcurrant and red currant with a base of ambergris, laudanum and opoponax.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poison

questions.question: This Union general earned the nickname The Rock of Chickamauga.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Thomas

questions.question: 1983 was the year when this style of clothing finally went out of style.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Disco
